metadata.title: CVE-2022-47024 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference issue was discovered in functiongui_x11_create_blank_mouse in gui_x11.c in vim 8.1.2269 thru 9.0.0339allows attackers to cause denial of service or other unspecified impacts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm6').
